statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola Marymnt 83, Monmouth (N.J.) 70
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Charles Brown scored a game-high 19 points for Loyola Marymount in an 83-70 win Saturday over Monmouth in the season opener for both teams. Adoyah Evans-Miller and Matthew Knight added 14 and 13 points, respectively, for the Lions, who turned 22 Monmouth turnovers into 24 points. Monmouth (0-1), which returned three starters including its two leading scorers from last year's NCAA Tournament-qualifying team, struggled with Loyola Marymount's pressure man-to-man defense and full-court press. Dejan Delic led the Hawks with 16 points, Blake Hamilton scored 15 and Marques Alston had 13. Loyola Marymount led 31-28 at the half despite shooting just 33 percent in the first 20 minutes. Monmouth pulled within one on Corey Hallett's outside jumper on the first possession of the second half, but the Lions went on a 15-3 run and converted four turnovers into eight points during that stretch for a 46-33 lead with 15:34 left. Monmouth managed to close the gap nine at 72-63 on Hallett's three-point play with 3:57 left, but Brown, who is the Lions' lone senior, answered with a 3-pointer on Loyola Marymount's next possession. Brandon Worthy had five of Loyola Marymount's 11 steals.
